learnings.title: string
Hypertension
Cholesterol
HbA1c
learnings.short_description: A condition of persistently high blood pressure
A waxy substance found in the blood that can increase risk of heart disease when levels are high
A blood test that measures average blood sugar levels over the past 2-3 months
learnings.detailed_description: Hypertension is defined as having a blood pressure reading of 130/80 mmHg or higher. It can increase risk of heart attack, stroke and kidney disease if left uncontrolled. Management includes lifestyle changes and medications.

Cholesterol is a waxy substance found in the blood that can increase risk of heart disease when levels are high. There are different types of cholesterol, including LDL (bad) cholesterol and HDL (good) cholesterol. Management includes lifestyle changes and medications to help lower LDL cholesterol levels.

HbA1c is a blood test that measures average blood sugar levels over the past 2-3 months. It is used to diagnose and monitor diabetes. A normal HbA1c level is below 5.7%. A level between 5.7% and 6.4% indicates prediabetes, and a level of 6.5% or higher indicates diabetes.

learnings.title: string
Importance of blood pressure control
Use of humidifier for deviated nasal septum
Effect of deviated septum on snoring
learnings.short_description: Controlling blood pressure is important to reduce risk of heart attack and stroke.

A deviated nasal septum can contribute to snoring and sleep apnea.
learnings.detailed_description: Controlling blood pressure is important to reduce risk of heart attack and stroke. Lifestyle changes such as regular exercise, a healthy diet and limiting alcohol intake can help with blood pressure control. Medications may also be needed for some patients.

Using a humidifier can help with nasal congestion caused by a deviated nasal septum. It adds moisture to the air and can help reduce dryness and irritation in the nasal passages. This can be especially helpful during dry winter months or in dry climates.

A deviated nasal septum can contribute to snoring and sleep apnea by causing obstruction of the airway during sleep. Treatment options for a deviated septum include nasal strips, decongestants, or surgery to correct the deviation.
